title: Fire near Wise Co. natural gas plant forces evacuations
content:
Wise County fire (Photo: WFAA) 

WISE COUNTY -- Evacuations are underway in Chico, Texas after a fire broke out near a natural gas plant. 

The Targa North Texas plant is located about 40 miles west of Denton in Wise County. The fire broke out at about 2:15 a.m. inside a compressor building at the gas processing facility. 

"The plant, which is not involved in the fire, was immediately shut down per our emergency procedures and all employees were safely evacuated," Targa said in a release. "There were no injuries and everyone associated with the facility is accounted for. Emergency responders were notified. Homes in the surrounding area were evacuated as a safety precaution, and people from about ten homes within about 1-1/2 miles of the plant have been temporarily relocated to local motels." 

The fire was still burning as of 7:30 a.m. and officials said they hoped to let it burn itself out before they allow employees to reenter. 

"We will not know the cause until the fire is out and we are able to conduct a complete investigation. County Road 1745, in close proximity to the plant is currently closed," Targa said. 

The company says it doesn't believe facility operations will be impacted for more than a few days.
